briefdescription.para: The loader contains all of the nodes we're going to run.
The Program is the compiled Yarn program.
We'll ask this object for the state of variables.
The library contains all of the functions and operators we know about.
The collection of nodes that we've seen.
A function exposed to Yarn that returns the number of times a node has been run.

detaileddescription.para: If no parameters are supplied, returns the number of time the current node has been run.

briefdescription.para: A Yarn function that returns true if the named node, or the current node if no parameters were provided, has been visited at least once.

memberdef.argsstring: (string fileName, bool showTokens=false, bool showParseTree=false, string onlyConsiderNode=null)
memberdef.name: LoadFile

memberdef.argsstring: (string text, string fileName="<input>", bool showTokens=false, bool showParseTree=false, string onlyConsiderNode=null)
memberdef.name: LoadString

briefdescription.para: Ask the loader to parse a string.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the number of nodes that were loaded.

briefdescription.para: Use this in a for-each construct; each time you iterate over it, you'll get a line, command, or set of options.
Returns the source code for the node 'nodeName', if that node was tagged with rawText.
Returns the tags for the node 'nodeName'.
The Dialogue class is the main thing that clients will use.
